wikipedia_page.main: Theodore Robinson (16 February 1866 – 4 October 1959) played first-class cricket for Somerset in 10 matches between 1884 and 1894. He was born at Beaminster in Dorset and died at Backwell, Somerset.

response: On 6 June 1929 Theodore Robinson opened the park to the public  and gave it to the "Children and adults of the parish of Backwell". The fields were opened on 6 June 1929 by the then Marquis of Bath, Thomas Thynne.Information given on the plaque on the stone in the Playing Fields (pictured in the article): "It was opened on 6th June 1929 by The Most Honorable The Marquis of Bath K.G."

response: *Theodore Robinson (1866-1959) an English first class cricketer, great nephew.
